boardgame.name: Raid on St. Nazaire
boardgame.description: This solitaire wargame simulates the March 28, 1942, British raid on the Nazi-occupied French port of St. Nazaire._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In the first part of the game, the player moves the British boats and destroyer HMS Campbeltown (camouflaged as a German ship) to their landing areas, while determining the results of the many shots from the harbor defense guns. Upon landing, the remaining force tries to reach targets (sub pens, caissons, docked ships, supply tanks, etc.) and destroy them._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The German guards are handled by the game system and arrive via random draw and placement and move by most direct route to the nearest British commando. As the game progresses, the German units get tougher and better organized._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The game ends when either all British units are killed or escape and they score for the targets destroyed._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 1987 Charles S. Roberts Best Wargame Graphics Nominee
1987 Charles S. Roberts Best Wargame Graphics Winner

1987 Charles S. Roberts Best World War II Board Game Winner

listing.notes: Used, but complete. Shipping within the US via insured priority mail. Note to International (non-US) buyers: I must declare actual value on all customs forms. **I will not falsify values on customs forms, no exceptions!**. For International orders, only Paypal is accepted.

Game complete - Maps, Rules, Game Log (only 1 page used), Dice, Counters. Counters punched and sorted in polybags. Box shows very minor shelf wear (primarily on the black corners), otherwise colours are still fresh and unfaded.
In excellent condition throughout, counters punched but no noticeable wear and lots of log pads remaining.

Complete in box. Terrific condition.

*********** NOTE: Condition-wise, this is in very good condition. But the missing counters will need to be replaced in order to make the game work as designed. At minimum, you will need to replace the 6 missing German counters to make it play as designed, though in theory the game could be played with the incorrect mix, since you would be missing no more than 2 from a specific Alarm Level. *********** Missing: the three colored six-sided dice and 17 counters (see below). The rulebook is crisp, there are plenty of sheets left on the game log pad, and the three-piece board is in very good condition. The box shows light to moderate wear, mostly around the corners. What counters are missing and how important are they? ***SCALE*** A - You really need this counter! B - Necessary, but you can probably do with a substitute C - Necessary, but you definitely can do with a substitute D - Noticeable if you don_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;t have it, but passable. E - Not terribly important 1 x British Commando, Moss (B) 2 x Artillery Battery, 121 _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; 311 (A/B) 3 x Sunk/Withdrawn (E) 1 x Dockside Defensive Fire (C) 2 x Damaged/Destroy (E) 2 x Prepared Charges/Charges at Risk (D) 6 x German Strosstruppen (A, these are the strength chits pulled from the cup to randomize the opposition)
Punched, 100% complete.
Played a few times. All counters are present and stored in small plastic containers. Original game log.

Buyer pays my cost for shipping from Virginia, except for outside USA, for which I will charge $10 for handling plus shipping, duties, etc. Buyer pays for insurance, if you want it. (Recommended). Advise if you wish a particular shipping method.
